title: S Grade
body:
Okay we've all heard of the new hextech crafting right?
I was wondering, in order to get a chest (or key maybe) you needed to acheive an S grade in the game.
So far I've heard that to achieve an S grade you need to absolutely "wreck" in normal que (taken from youtuber "Brofresco") but as a frequent {{champion:201}}  support player I dont wreck. My best (and most recent) Braum game was a KDA of 3/13/31 (he kills were when I killed the ADC solo, y stuns are op XD)
I didnt wreck I died a load to save my team, and got a "crap load" of assists, sorry i didnt bother to check my grade, (but I think u can ony get graded when u reach rank 5?) so are the standards different for supps? or is it "rigged." I just want to know so that I know my goals for my {{champion:201}}  supp

replies.body:
you need to "wreck" relative to that champion. They don't compare a Braum game against a Riven. It compared Braum to other Braum players and sees how well you do in comparison.

I've had plenty of S games with supports. The best way is to limit your deaths. Going 1-1-10 is better than 1-4-20.
